instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio on headphone jack
threads.message:
Hey,
i'm working on a Macbook Pro mid 2014 15" that came with no audio. Located a partial short on <SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL>, caused by <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>.
After replacing <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> I got sound again with speakers but when i connect headphones to the audio jack i just get some deep "clicking noises" but no sound at all...
The macbook detects the headphones (in die sound settings).

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio on headphone jack
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio on headphone jack
threads.message: Yes, <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> is good. After replacing <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and noticing the Jack problem I replaced it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio on headphone jack
threads.message: Headphones amplifier is embedded into <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>; try another chip.
